Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  To answer your question â€“ We do allow four hours between check-out at 11AM and check-in at 3PM to prepare rooms for the next guest.  A vast majority of the time our rooms are available early; however, when we are busy it may not be possible to check guests in early.    We apologize that Margarita was not wearing her name tag when you visited the Lodge.    Regarding the decision not to check you in, considering your exchange at the Front Desk management felt it was in the best interest of all concerned.

Summary Heading: Comfortable and convenient hotel to suit all visitors to the area
Summary: We have stayed at Laguna Hills Lodge several times when visiting family in the area.  The location is ideal for local shopping and restaurants. The hotel rooms are very clean, comfortable, well equipped and the hotel has very friendly staff. The gardens are kept beautifully and the pool is very pleasant. The breakfast is very good and has a lot of choice for all tastes.  I look forward to my next visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I attended a wedding at Laguna Beach and had reserved a room there at Laguna Hills Lodge.  I am well traveled and am not the type of person that usually writes reviews on hotels that I've visited but this place was exceptional.  It was very clean and well maintained, inside and out.  It has a great location where you are literally walking distance from the local mall,  restaurants, and within ten minutes drive time from the beach.  There wasn't one complaint from my 12 year old daughter and while there and I slept like a rock.  I will definitely reserve a room there for my next visit.
Manager Response: Thanks for your five star rating.  We look forward to seeing you soon ^_^.

Summary: We liked this hotel so much, we booked it again, even getting the same room as requested! All the staff were so friendly & helpful, and our room was clean & spacious, with comfy beds. The room had a fridge, ice box & microwave. Pool area was lovely & the water was fab!  Lots of choice for a continental style breakfast, which really made this a great value stay, especially taking into account free parking & free wi-fi. There's also a free gym area & coin-op laundry. Only about 8 miles from gorgeous Laguna Beach, everyone should check out Treasure Island Park.
Manager Response: Glad that you "Love this place". ^_^

Summary: This hotel is located within walking distance to a mall and many restaurants.  Easy drive to Laguna Beach and on to Huntington and Newport Beach. It is just minutes to Irvine shopping malls and movies. The breakfast is a cold continental but they provide coupons for local restaurants.  2 coupons per room and kids 10 and under are free.  $5 per additional ticket.  Location was perfect!
Manager Response: Hi Kristin:  Thank you for your review!!

Summary Heading: Wish we could of stayed longer!
Summary: The location is very ideal as we stayed for only 1 night to be close to Verizon Wireless Amp for a concert. We were able to check in a little early and got a King Garden view room. Our building didn't have elevators but we only had to go up to the 2nd floor. The room was very clean and spacious - I like the fact the vanity is outside of the bathroom. We ended up walking to a nearby shopping center to fill up the fridge with drinks. We used the pool and had very quiet afternoon outside. The breakfast center is very nice and had a great selection. I enjoyed our stay that I wish we could of stayed longer than the one night we had planned.... especially for the price! ($103 -- not bad in OC!)  The only downside -- they don't allow smoking on the property except in one small little
Manager Response: We wish you could stay longer too, thank you for the five star rating ^_^.

Summary: I've waited a few months since my visit so that I could look at the hotel from a point of view not clouded by the feel good factor of having just returned from a wonderful holiday there.   The location of this hotel is perfect for everything. Many lovely restaurants are a short 5-15min walk with a shopping centre just across the road.   The grounds of the hotel were beautiful with flowers in full bloom and the whole grounds were kept in wonderful and clean condition.   My fiance and I found the hotel staff to be most helpful, even going so far as to recommend the best dinning and drinking places and then helping us organise taxi's.   We were there during the football world cup and I was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere during breakfast when everyday a game was on the TV.
Manager Response: Hi Matt: We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review ^_^.

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet, and very accessible to beaches
Summary: This hotel was a very nice place... The room was nice and large.  Very quiet.  The location is convenient to tons of shopping and dining out. Also within 30 minutes to local beaches. Staff was very polite.  Will definitely stay there again!!!
Manager Response: Hi Vickie: "Clean, quiet....", thank you for your feedback.  Come back soon ^+^.

Summary: The location is ideal, close to everything, including shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Beds were clean. Garden views overrated, definitely not worth extra 50%. The pool was nice, and the jacuzzi seemed to be working. Continental breakfast was good.  Management and most of front desk staff were very slow, unaccommodating and belligerent. They blamed Orbitz for all shortcomings, and even went as far as to tell us to call the hotel directly to book next time. We were told the hotel was totally booked, but the mostly empty parking lot would lead us to believe otherwise. At the end of our stay, they refused to give us a copy of our bill, saying they had to send it to Orbitz.  They kept our credit information, even though I was told there were no extra charges.  Many
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  To answer your question, since your reservation was made through Orbitz, Orbitz provides you with a copy of your bill.  Regarding your credit card, the Lodge, as most hotels, take a credit card to cover incidentals, damage or disputes.    Regarding your comment about the parking lot, there may not be a lot of cars in the parking lot at mid-day because guests are not in their rooms or have yet to check-in.    Regarding your comments about our property, if you would like to provide us with your room number we would be happy to double check the room and area to ensure it is in very good condition.  We are a family owned hotel with a staff that has been with us for many years.  We take great pride in the excellent condition of the property.

Summary Heading: An inexpensive alternative to Laguna Beach
Summary: The rooms are very nice, except they put the toilets too close to the wall. But if you are looking for a clean and well maintained room that won't cost an arm and a leg, it is a great place to stay. We have stayed 4 different times and all have been satisfactory. We tend to spend the day in Laguna Beach and then just sleep here. Always seem to get Building C which is located at the parking lot, so not a view of the beautiful gardens, but quite convenient. The gardens are very pretty to walk around, beautiful roses! Free light breakfast and paper each day. Beds can be a bit too firm.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Conveniently located very near amazing wonders of nature and poetic places, close to major art and entertainment venues that attract visitors from all over the world. The enchanting gardens of the Laguna Hills Lodge wrap around the buildings, making the view from all the rooms pleasant and relaxing. Their complimentary continental breakfast is average; rooms have smallish bathrooms but are clean and comfortable; the staff at reception could crack a smile every now and then. Across the street is the Total Woman gym (modern & fabulously equiped!) Not far from Disneyland, the Queen Mary, Long Beach Aquarium of the Pacific, Knox Berry Farms, Medieval Times, the Great Park, etc. Walking distance from the Elephant Bar Restaurant, Chick-Fil-A, Rubio's Fish Tacos, and the Laguna Hills
Manager Response: none

Summary: Convenient location. Very affordable. Beautiful gardens. Clean and well maintained. Good breakfast. For being an older motel that's been renovated it's very nice. Sure I could nit-pick but I'm not expecting a 5 star hotel. I've stayed in the area in several different motels and I'd definitely stay here again.  Further proof, my husband is a germaphobe and he gives this place 4 thumbs up (he borrowed mine).
Manager Response: Hello Shelly, thank you for your comments "Convenient and Beautiful".

Summary: We were going to spend the weekend in Laguna Hills, at the beach side and looked for a place to stay. We performed random search on the phone and found this place. It was garden picture and we wondered how it would looked in reality and how the service would be. Anyway, we arrived at the lodge and were really delighted by their customer service at the registration desk. We picked our rooms and were also amazed how comfortable and clean were the rooms. In the morning, we had a very healthy breakfast, which was included in the price. We left the place with nice feeling and with the thoughts to stay here in our next trip back to Laguna Hills. Highly recommended place to stay. Thanks to staff for great service.
Manager Response: Thank you for your five star review.

Summary Heading: Amazing find in the Laguna Beach area!!
Summary: When I booked a room at this property I had my doubts ...the price seemed too good to be true for this area!! July anywhere near Laguna beach is VERY expensive (rooms all in the $300 range) So I thought @ $95 per night I was going to be disappointed upon arrival. NOT TRUE!!   This is a beautiful property!!  It is spacious, comfortable, with newly renovated rooms with all of the amenities I would have received closer to the beach had I paid hundreds more!!! The grounds are stunning (I asked for a garden view room) the pool area inviting, the staff was super nice...and the daily FREE breakfast was astounding !!! No, you are not on the each,or within walking distance to it...however a 20 minute drive to Laguna Beach or Crystal Cove state Park  is alright by me to stay in a lovely
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Lodge was dated but the rooms were updated and comfortable.   The continental breakfast left a lot to be desired-cold cereal, sweet rolls, yogurt, coffee and juice.   Fire Station across the street so there were sirens throughout the night.   Staff was helpful.   Location was good for our purposes.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value for money - but no frills.
Summary: This is my third visit to Laguna Beach. Previously I have stayed in hotels overlooking the beach, but this time I was ready for a change, staying in the hills around fifteen minutes drive down to the coast. The accommodation is excellent value for money, but is a bit tired in places and needing some improvement. It is more of a motel than a hotel. The room was basic but clean. A very adequate breakfast was included in the price. The gardens and pool area were very well cared for and kept clean. The hotel is situated on a main road. Vouchers are offered for nearby restaurants, but these are in an unattractive shopping mall but within walking distance. It is best to drive into Laguna Beach for memorable dining.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My mother, my daughter and I took a trip to California and stayed in Laguna Hills Lodge for 8 nights. Our first impression of the Lodge was that it was perfect. My daughter (14 years old) actually said, "we could just stay here the whole time" no need to see any of the tourist sights.   Our experience everyday coming and going was delightful and we repeatedly commented how perfect the it was for our stay. It was like staying in a garden. There were bougainvillea vines growing up the balcony of each room. Roses were everywhere.    The staff is friendly and they serve a good breakfast every day. The room rate is very affordable, and it is easy to access from the freeway.  I just can't say enough good things about this place.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for such a nice review!!

Summary Heading: LAGUNA HILLS LODGE IS LIKE A MOTEL
Summary: Laguna Hills Lodge is located in a area near a mall and a shopping center in Laguna Hills, CA. The lodge looks much better in the pictures and to us, it looks more like a motel than a hotel. Even though the lodge was remodeled last year, it still looks very outdated. My family and I spent three nights at Laguna Hills Lodge. The first day, when we got there our room smelled like urine. I was not sure if somebody used the closet as a bathroom and I complained about it. The owners of the property, Japanese or Korean, were nice and one of them came into our room to spray some chemical where the smell was. The breakfast was good but it wasn't hot. We received only two vouchers  for daily breakfast even though we paid the room for three persons. So if you are 4 persons per room, you
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We appreciate your input and apologize that there was a smell in your room.  Our rooms go through two inspections before guests are checked-in so I ask that you write us as to the date of your stay and room number. I will be happy to follow-up with my team to ensure this problem does not happen again. Thank you for letting us know that our staff went to your room to address the problem.  Regarding breakfast, our rooms include a free continental breakfast for two plus children under ten years of age are free.   The breakfast is detailed on our website, including the $5 charge for additional breakfast vouchers.  Again, we appreciate your letting us know that you had a problem with your room.  We apologize for the problem.

Summary: We were pleased by the spacious, clean room as well as the lovely grounds.  The staff was exceptionally friendly.  It was a nice surprise to discover a (slightly) heated salt water poor and a hot tub on the grounds.  We had come to spend time at Laguna Beach and the hotel is about a 15 min. drive from there.  No need to pay high costs for the beach when this place is so close.  There were many dining places in and around Laguna Hills as well.  If you stay, request the rooms facing the very pretty inner courtyard.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review score of 4 out of 5.

Summary: The service was friendly, and this property is centrally located close to many Orange County points of interests for an inland hotel.  The room is spacious and comfortable.  The free daily breakfast was ok, but this hotel has discount agreements with several nearby restaurants.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: "Great value", thanks so much ^_^.

Summary: Now, when I travel for business I typically go to a property where I get award points.  Well, this one may just change my mind.  It's not a chain property, I'll tell you that straight up.  What it is is clean, well-maintained, and, at least in my room, supplied with a really good bed.  All the drains worked right, the shower worked, and it was a great value for the price.  You can get a feel for the way things are to be by the greeting at the desk.  This gentlemen was great.  Interested in my travels, concerned that I get settled in as it had been a long, long day.  He was welcoming right from the get-go.  Nice change from some of the come-see-come-saw of others I've lodged at.  They have also arranged with several restaurants nearby for user discounts, a nice touch.  They have
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an older hotel but it's friendly staff, clean rooms & beautiful grounds make it a perfect stop. It's easy to get to & although it's not a "beach hotel" it's an easy drive to Laguna Beach.  The continental breakfast is wonderful!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review score of 5 out of 5!

Summary: I book this hotel every year for a conference at SaddleBack Church for some of our ministry leaders and they do a great job! Roland and His team are committed to providing excellent service. We will continue to book there!!!
Manager Response: "Job well Done!, thank you ^_^.

Summary: My wife and I spent one weekend night and loved it. Good price, location close to Laguna beach (15 minute drive), quiet room, comfortable bed,  awesome and courteous service, and good continental breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel if on business or pleasure.
Manager Response: "Great service and rooms", thank you for your feedback.

Summary: I stayed at the Laguna Hills lodge for one night.  The amenities are great: pool, sauna, gym, laundry, continental breakfast and more.  The room I had was on the second floor.  I was actually surprised at how quiet it was even though the hotel was completely booked. The breakfast had a variety of cereals and breads. There were hard boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit etc. The rooms were very clean and offered showtime along with other regular channels. My room had 2 sitting chairs, and an ottoman which was nice. It had a mirrored closet as well.  No elevators though. The staff I interacted with were accommodating.  Overall, it was a nice place to stay for the price.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, "Nice place to stay".

Summary Heading: Looks good but not that comfortable! OK with a NET deal!
Summary: Looks can be deceiving.  The bed looks good but is not comfortable.  The pillows look good but are horrid to sleep on.  The easy chair looks good but is not enjoyable. The breakfast room looks good but is not welcoming.    The in-room coffee is far superior to the dreck in the BK room. The biz center is fine and one of the best things here.  The AC did work well and the rooms are quiet and the shower had good water pressure.  Be prepared to get attitude at the desk if you are prepaid with a deal from the internet but the ONLY way to stay here.  They act like you are a steerage or coach guy who sneaked up to first class.  Once is fine - I would not make a habit of this place.  It looks good but is not welcoming or comfortable.  Bring your own pillow if you value your sleep.  Do
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is our go to place once a year when we attend the extraordinary Pageant of the Masters.  The staff is always friendly and we've never had any complaints in all the years we've been coming.  The beds and pillows are perfect, there's a fridge, microwave, room safe, plenty of free parking, an elevator, in room coffee, continental breakfast, multiple TV channels, good lighting, free wifi, nice granite sink/vanity, toiletries, plenty of space to set your things, and it's fairly quiet.  I slept till 8:00 this morning, but I do wear earplugs when away from home. Yesterday the pool wasn't that crowded in spite of it being July.  It's an older property but very clean and the rooms look updated. Some rooms are near a busy street so there is traffic noise during the day, but the
Manager Response: Hi Linda, thank you for your repeat business!

Summary: Stayed 6 nights at the Laguna Hills Lodgeâ€¦ had a second floor room.  Property is lovely, the room was clean and very comfortable.  Nice to have a fridge in the room.  The breakfast was good, although no hot food available.  When we arrived, we were given a breakfast "voucher" for each morning of our visit.  However, on our 3rd morning, we were told by one of the workers at breakfast that we needed a voucher for each of us.  We were told we only needed one - so we had to go back to the front desk and explain that we needed more vouchers.  They didn't hesitate to give us more, but we should have been given 2 per day in the beginning.  Other than this one issue, the visit was great.  Used the pool a few times - pretty much had the place to ourselves.  Also used the laundry, which
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind and thoughtful review of our hotel.  We are happy you enjoyed your stay at the Lodge.  We just want to apologize again for the mix up with your breakfast vouchers.   We are glad it was easily resolved and are also glad you let us know that you had a problem.   Thank you again for your positive and constructive comments.

Summary Heading: A very nice hotel close to my family.
Summary: I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to this area. Our friend recommended this hotel to us and we would definitely recommend this establishment to other people. We were pleased with all aspects of the services received. We appreciated the coupons for nearby restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you for the five star review ^_^.

Summary: I will definitely stay at this lovely property again . The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was wonderful, great size, very clean and the breakfast was awesome! Very centrally located for my stay as I was never far from Newport, Laguna Beach, Laguna Hills, Mission Viejo...and VERY reasonable rates.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us, see you soon ^_^.

Summary: We stayed at laguna Hills lodge for one night. The check-in desk clerk was very nice. Our room faced out to Paseo de Valencia. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom is a tight squeeze but we managed. The mini fridge/freezer was turned off when we arrived ...once we turned it on we realized why it was turned off.....it hummed pretty loudly. The AC unit was a bit loud, too. Thankfully, we only needed the AC on for a short time but we could hear the unit in the room next to us. Glad we are good sleepers as it probably would have kept most people up. We were awakened at 8am by a fire engine siren. The fire station is right across the street. We laughed because 8am was the exact time we wanted to get up so the siren was like an alarm clock. Glad it was a quiet night
Manager Response: Thank you for writing such a positive review on your experience staying at our hotel.  We really appreciate all of the wonderful guests who take the time to tell others they enjoyed their visit with us.  We wanted to comment on your observation that your AC and room refrigerator were noisy.  If any guest has a problem with a noisy appliance, please call the Front Desk and they will send a maintenance team member to your room to troubleshoot.  If they cannot solve the problem, we have extra ACs and refrigerators we can easily install in your room.  All of our ACs are just three years old and shouldn't be noisy.  We apologize for any inconvenience this caused you.  Again, thank you so much for your review.

Summary Heading: Run Don't Walk From this Dump with a Nasty Attitute
Summary: DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Okay so here are the minor reasons that I could live with: dingy, old, no amenities. Here are the reasons that are really annoying and unacceptable: staff including and especially the manager Roland has a very nasty attitude in which the guest is always wrong. Here is the reason that makes this a "run as fast as you can and don't book here": the room was filthy. There was literally a pile of trash in about 3 spots in the room when we checked in including a soap covered in hair and pills on the floor in plain view. My feeling is that if I can see the dirt then there is definitely microscopic dirt that I can not see. When I complained to Roland he claimed that I was lying, took a nasty attitude with me (this was after another staff at his direction accused
Manager Response: We have read your review and are delighted that you have provided us with the opportunity to respond publicly.  While it is true that the Laguna Hills Lodge is historically the original hotel in the area, it was completely remodeled in 2009 and is constantly being updated.  Our amenities include free parking, free high-speed Wi-Fi, beautiful pool and spa, saunas, fitness center and many other amenities that are listed on our website and other travel sites.      Regarding your complaint to our Front Desk that your room was dirty, our staff responded immediately by contacting the maid (a senior employee of 20 years) who cleaned your room.  She reported that it was clean.  We then also had our housekeeping supervisor (with over 30 yearsâ€™ experience at the Lodge) inspect your room and she confirmed that it was clean.    As evidenced by the hundreds of reviews on Trip Advisor and other travel sites, room cleanliness is a consistent compliment we receive from our guests from all over the world.  You and your guests did use a much larger number of towels than is usual.  Our Front Desk does keep track of towel usage to make sure enough towels are available at all times for all of our guests.  You seemed to have gotten a wrong impression that someone on our staff accused you of stealing towels.  To the best of our knowledge, this is not true and certainly would never reflect behavior we would condone on our property.   As owners, we were happy that our staff tried to accommodate you by offering a room discount.     We are sorry you felt that your stay was unsatisfactory.

Summary: We were very impressed with the cleanliness of the Laguna Hills Lodge. Upon arrival the room was spotless, and it was kept that way daily. The manager, Roland, was very accommodating in arranging for a necessary first floor room. The king-sized bed was excellent quality, as were the linens and towels. The included continental breakfast was more than adequate. Some hotels equate continental with just pastries, but Laguna Hills Lodge includes a variety of cold cereals, muffins, pastries, hard boiled eggs, bagels, toast, and more. The breakfast room was a bit on the small side and could be crowded, so several mornings we had to take our food back to our room. The location of the hotel was excellent, and we were, for the most part, undisturbed by other guests. My only criticism is
Manager Response: Thank you for the headline "Great Place" ^_^.

Summary: The room was perfectly clean, and the breakfast was just what we wanted.  The grounds were beautifully landscaped.  The staff was friendly.  Laguna Hills is a nice area.  Areas for improvement:  bigger wastebaskets in the rooms (the wastebaskets were tiny and could barely hold more than a few things);  better internet access ( the wi-fi was sporadic);  and bigger TVs (the TVs were small).  Overall however, we  had a good experience and would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: We appreciate your review.

Summary: I recently stayed at the Laguna Hills Lodge and had a very good overall experience. Room was adequate although a/c unit was noisy. Continental breakfast daily included for two with your stay. Good food such as hard boiled eggs, cereal, toast and muffins. Nice large heated pool up to 8ft on one side opened till 11pm nightly. Best thing is the location. Minutes from John Wayne Airport (SNA) and within about an hour of San Diego Zoo, Legoland, Universal Studios and Knottsberry Farm. Great Package Price for these attractions at smartdestinations.com.
Manager Response: Yep, we have a super location just across the street from a regional mall and a short drive to the beach ^_^.

Summary: The whole ambience is simply tired but the place works and is so easy to find after a long flight to LAX. Neatly kept and clean but as dated as many clients. Reception was friendly to a guy who turned up 24 hours late due to airline issues. Will use next time I come to work nearby.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to post a review.

Summary: My fiancÃ© and I stayed here for two nights at the end of May. The hotel grounds were beautiful and our room was clean. The location is the best part about this hotel. It is centrally located and easily accessible from the 5 freeway. It is also nice that there is a Chick-fil-A and In-N-Out within walking distance.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: old wine in a new bottle
Summary: after reading all the reviews, my expectations grew large..this hotel is an old hotel which has been recently renovated..the location of this hotel is a major advantage for itself.. the staff were extremely helpful.  the breakfast spread could have been better
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just in town for one night.  With a family, we usually try and find something with breakfast included.  Laguna Lodge allots 2 breakfast tickets...any extra cost $5/per person.  Breakfast includes dry cereal, toast or pastry (which they monitor), juice, coffee, milk, yogurt and hard boiled eggs.  That's it.  And there is a huge sign in the breakfast room which states only 1 serving per person.    The TV in the room is super tiny.  I've included a picture.  The dÃ©cor is dated and room smelled  "musty".  The grounds are beautiful and the pool area is nice.  We didn't try the sauna or the exercise room.  Check out is 11am. We received a phone call 10 minutes before check out to remind us of the check out time!  I would definitely not recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay at our hotel.  For clarification, our free breakfast vouchers are allocated for two people per room and also free for children 10 and under.  Most of our guests feel that a small charge for extra guests in the room is not unreasonable.  Our breakfast room attendant is there to toast bread and bagels to order and hand out pastries to guests for sanitary reasons.  Alberto and German are quite popular with guests who appreciate the personal service.  Our room dÃ©cor was completely remodeled and redecorated in 2009 and we are constantly refreshing the look.  Weâ€™re sorry if the room style was not to your taste.    As far as the reminder phone call concerning checkout, this is a policy that we implement during the summer months when we have high occupancy to insure that rooms are vacated and cleaned in a timely manner for the next guestsâ€™ arrivals.

Summary Heading: Large Rooms, Well Maintained Property, Have stayed at LHL many times
Summary: Laguna Hills Lodge is so nice! The grounds  and facilities are impeccably maintained and provide a nice ambiance. Rooms are large, with king size bed, balcony and dressing area. Bathrooms are a bit tiny, but will do. Breakfast room very clean, variety of options, even if same each day. Location is super, near I-5 and close to our family who lives in Irvine. Staff provides great service. Restaurants and a mall so close, including an In-and-Out and BJ's nearby. The Lodge has a swimming pool, workout room and business center. Wi-Fi works great. Only drawback, and it is a small one, is the fire station located near building C. When they make a run, one hears the sirens, yet this does not happen frequently. We have stayed here many times over the years and continue to return. In
Manager Response: "Well maintained", I will pass on your feedback to my team ^_^.

Summary: This was the second time my wife and stayed at the Laguna Lodge this year.  We have stayed due to procedures I was having done at the nearby Saddleback Memorial Health Center.  As with our previous stay the staff was most helpful giving us a room with easy access and let us check in early.  The room were quiet and comfortable.  One suggestion I would give the staff would be "brightened up" the rooms, but I am sure that will come when they are remodeled in the future.  The grounds, as mentioned in so many other reviews, are beautiful and relaxing.  The breakfast was more than adequate and the service friendly.  This is truly a hidden gem and at very reasonable price compared to the surrounding motels.  I would most definitely recommend this motel to travelers.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review!!

Summary Heading: Beautiful, but not so much with the service
Summary: I was attracted by the price, lovely pictures and good reviews. All these were basically valid, but there were oddities with the service that I found disconcerting. The lodge has 3 buildings, one with the breakfast room, yet they provide no map to show where rooms (including breakfast) or ice machines were. Our room was a well furnished accessible room on the first floor.The Continental breakfast was odd in that bread and pastry items were behind glass and only available when asking their guard/server and giving a ticket provided by the management to room holders for each day's stay. Room lighting was controlled by timed motion detectors on short cycles. Their emphasis on returning of electronic keys, response to the lack of map, and restricted access to breakfast items was
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments about our hotel.  We want to assure you that your personal safety should be of no concern.  Let us clarify some of the issues you mentioned to ease your mind.    Room lighting -- As part of â€œgreenâ€ practices at our hotel, our room lights are on motion detectors; the settings are those recommended by SoCal Edison.  The intent is to be environmentally responsible.    Breakfast â€“ our servers are not there to police the food but to provide personal and sanitary service.  Most of our guests enjoy Alberto and Germanâ€™s personal touch and good humor.  Keys â€“ Key control is important to any hotel and in addition our high tech room keys are very expensive to replace.  The Laguna Hills Lodge is located in a very safe, low crime area.  In addition, the Police Department is next door.  We donâ€™t provide maps because the property is small and easy for Front Desk staff to provide navigation.  If you felt that you needed a map as well that is certainly something we could consider in the future.  Again, thank you for taking the time to comment.

Summary: The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  You were greeted with smiles, a daily newspaper, free continental breakfast voucher for each guest, and a coupon sheet for discounts on local restaurants.  The room was spotless and the beds were very comfortable.  The grounds were beautiful.  We had a first floor room and were able to pull up directly in front of our room, which was a huge plus.  My friend and I were amazed that after knowing dozens of teenagers were staying at the hotel that evening that the hotel was exceptionally quiet.  A few added pluses included the 60 channel television selection and having both a microwave and refrigerator/freezer.  I wish more hotels were like this.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback "Diamond in the Rough".

Summary: My friend and I were looking for a place to stay before an exam at prometric. We saw on tripadvisor the excellent review of the lodge, and decided to stay here. True to all the reviews, the lodge was filled with flowers and looked like a little "secret garden".   The room was clean, comfortable, and spacious.  The bed was very comfortable.  The continental breakfast was good and consisted of a variety of foods more so than the typical continental breakfasts.  The only problem I had was that the hotel was in close proximity to a large road and it was a bit noisy at night. We arrived around 12:45 pm and were told that our confirmation had not been received yet, that check-in time wasn't until 3:00 pm, and that we should leave and come back later.  We weren't going to go anywhere with our vehicles loaded down (we live on the road) so we were just going to wait.  Again it was mentioned...you can leave and come back. . I thought this was pretty rude.  We were finally given a room at 1:45 pm.  The room was on the second floor with no elevator in this building.  As we travel fulltime, we have a lot of stuff..so this was very inconvenient.  They said that we had been given
Manager Response: We are sorry that you were unhappy with your stay at our hotel.  We would like to clarify some of the issues you brought up.  All of our rooms except 5 (out of 121) and all premises are non-smoking.  You, as a smoker, chose a non-smoking room.  For the comfort of our guests, we are very strict about smoking in anywhere but our one outdoor designated area.  Secondly, our photos on websites is how all of our rooms look.  Our pricing is based on location on the property.  Check in is clearly stated to be 3:00 p.m. and getting you in your room at 1:45 p.m. does not seem to be unreasonable.  Lastly, our fitness center is air-conditioned.  Thank you for giving us this opportunity to respond to your comments.

Summary Heading: Hrd to match on location,service,friendliness of staff or cost
Summary: We've all read the previous reviews so any comments I might make will not enhance the excellent  and well deserved reputation of this destination so here is a little bit more about the layout of the place.It's about a 15 min drive south of OC airport and comprises of 121 rooms in 3 sections,Section B is located on 2 floors(with elevator) and part faces the beautifully manicured gardens which I am advised has over 360 varities of roses and part faces the main road so is slightly noisier,,Section C is on 3 floors(with elevator) and on the ground floor includeds the breakfast room open from 07.00-10.00hrs every day(in our 15 day stay the fayre never got boring because of the variety on offer) and is closest to the main road and nearest to the local fire station(god bless em) so is
Manager Response: Thank you for the five star rating!!!!!

Summary: I stayed on business for a few days at this hotel in late May 2012.  This is what I would call a very nice moderate hotel. The hotel style is something like a multi-story LaQuinta or Best Western, but it is a class above in its amenities and maintenance. The lobby is decorated with marble, wood paneling, and fancy art and chandeliers typical of a more upscale hotel. The staff was very helpful and I received probably the best ever briefing (without any prompting) upon check-in that I've ever received anywhere, on the hotel features and facilities, including a card of local restaurants and where they would give discounts as a hotel guest. They also provided a free cookie!  The grounds are particularly well maintained with a lot of very neatly trimmed hedges, greenery, and flowers
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A nice hotel close to shopping mall
Summary: Laguna Hills Lodge is a pretty hotel with nice surroundings, the rooms are a wee bit small but are spotless and the small swimming pool is quite good fun all in all a pleasant hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights  - was originally meant to be 9 but friends found out I was in town and insisted I stay with them. I have high praise for this hotel.  Location: SUPERB!! Right near the Laguna Hills Mall, the freeway, restaurants, and a short drive from the beach. When you're on the grounds, you forget you're surrounded by the busy town! It's simply wonderful. I also had no trouble with noise at all.   Presentation: the gardens are gorgeous and well maintained. The feel of the place made me think I was in Hawaii or some tropical paradise.  Cleanliness: Great. Rooms are cleaned well and the hotel itself looks well maintained.  Service: always friendly. I had to check out five days early and this was handled quickly, efficiently and courteously.   Value:
Manager Response: none

Summary: As you can tell from the title this is my 4th time, in 3 years. I like this hotel, it is convenient to everything, the freeway south to San Diego and north Anaheim and LA , Laguna Beach is just a short 15 minute drive and restaurants are close by as well. If you like barbeque try Lucilleâ€™s Smokehouse and Barbeque it less than a mile from the hotel.  The staff is friendly, and helpful. The rooms are clean and have the conveniences I look for; a refrigerator/freezer, microwave, iron and ironing board, hair dryer (for those of you that have hair) and of course a  TV, radio and air conditioning . The beds are very comfortable, providing good support without being hard. The pool is clean, kept well balanced and the temperature just right, even Goldilocks would be pleased. The gardens
Manager Response: Thanks for your repeat business!

Summary: We stayed here for 5 days with our 3 kids.The room was very nice, comfortable and most of all clean!  There is a safe, fridge and microwave, which worked out perfect if we wanted popcorn, or sandwiches.  The pool and hot tub were so great!  We also really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast each morning.  The drive to Laguna Beach is so pretty through the hills, and only took about 20 minutes. (on google maps for mobile)  We could hop on I-5 to get to Disney which was really convenient too.  Even the cost was nice.  We will definately stay here again and again!!
Manager Response: "Clean and Beautiful", thanks so much for staying with us!

Summary: Don't be put off by the exterior of the buildings.  The rooms have been remodeled and the gardens are lovely.  It is also very convenient to the freeway, right across the street from a mall, and close to numerous restaurants.  Without a doubt I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.

Summary: I had a 10yr old with me and he loved the pool and breakfast..i highly recommed it for families!
Manager Response: We appreciate your five star review!

Summary Heading: The place to stay for Laguna Beach or Newport Beach
Summary: Summary: A really nice hotel, we'd recommend staying there if you want to visit Laguna Or Newport Beaches.  Location: About 2-3 hours drive from LA and 30 minutes from Laguna Beach and (a bit further to) Newport Beach. It's just off the motorwy so easy to get too and from. It's on the edge of a shopping centre so lot to shops, petrol and restaurants.  Room: Room was large and spacious, as was the bathroom. TV was new and LCD with E! and Bravo, so the wife was happy!  Cleanliness: Very clean, rooms looked newly renovated and the courtyards and outer areas were also well   Facilities: Has a small gym as well as an outdoor swimming pool and Jacuzzi. It also has washing machines and dryers.  Breakfast: has a large hot and cold breakfast selection in a spacious (about 10-12 seating
Manager Response: As a family owned business we thank you for staying with us, come back soon ^_^.

Summary: It was only good location, for our family of 4 we visit Disney land and Universal Studio and travel from San Diego to Santa Monica, and every night we would be back to sleep, and that's where we got the horrible experience, bed bugs since we  was  itching all night,very uncomfortable bed, and all night couldn't sleep.Unfortunately since we by this hotel in a package we had to safer every night, we didn't talk to any one about it sine the front desk was very unfriendly, and told my husband that the owner is very old and didn't care about anything.
Manager Response: Thank you for reporting your concerns about your stay at our hotel.  We only wish you had come to us during your stay so we could have had an opportunity to troubleshoot.  After seeing your review here and on Travelocity, housekeeping and maintenance thoroughly checked the room and could find nothing.  We also use dogs specially trained to sniff for bedbugs - nothing.  The same room has been used by five separate guests since your stay and no complaints.  Perhaps you were bitten elsewhere during your trip.  These pesky critters are everywhere -- airlines, amusement parks, movie theaters, etc.  Bedbugs are such a widespread problem that we are zealous to protect our guests.  We have mattress encasements on all beds, regular pest control inspections, including the specially trained dogs, and our housekeeping staff has had professional training in recognizing and searching for bedbugs on a daily basis.  Lastly, we are a family owned and operated hotel.  I checked with the Front Desk staff that has been with us for many years and they assured me if they see an uncaring old man around the hotel, they'll let me know immediately!  Bill Crawford, General Manager, Laguna Hills Lodge

Summary: Traveled with my mom and two teenage boys. Our first room was a bit snug for 4( perfect for 2) so I asked about a more spacious room and they switched us right away. The room was very spacious with two comfortable chairs, a coffee table and a sofa.The grounds are beautiful. Flowers everywhere. Breakfast was good for a continental, well stocked and lots of choices. Will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review, and thanks for the five star rating.

Summary Heading: Potential for better, but not there yet....
Summary: We booked this room for one night a couple of weekends ago.  The property is situated at a terrific location; great restaurants nearby.  The staff at the front desk seemed pleasant enough, the property itself older, but somewhat charming.  The rooms were okay, but the bed was AWFUL which is why my rating went from a potential 4 to 3.  My husband didn't have as much of an issue with his side of the bed, but I evidently got the squeeky lumpy side.  For that alone I would probably take a pass on this property and spend a few more bucks for a decent nights' sleep.
Manager Response: Many thanks for your review.

Summary: Beautiful hotel, room smelt great, hot water took a few seconds or so to warm up but then was great, pool and hot tub was clean and nice. Breakfast was nice, the guy at the breakfast counter was always smiling. Mall right across the street along with great restaraunts. I-5 a few blocks away. Absolutly wonderful experience, price was reasonably too. Would difintly stay here.
Manager Response: Jean, thanks for the great headline "Great hotel".

Summary: Had a great two day adventure in the area with sister in law.  Nice grounds, nice greeting at reception.  Rooms were standard.  We were located near front fountain which was very nice.  Housekeeping did not refresh our toiletries.  Heater was noisy.  Since we had a deal on Living Social we did not complain.
Manager Response: Thank you for rating us four out of five stars.

Summary Heading: A convenient overnight stop just off Freeway
Summary: I suspect that   what happened was, the owner of LHL asked his mother to come and check the place out before the first guests arrived. That's why you'll find: microwave, small refrigerator, 5 free-standing lamps, very thick towels, a strategically placed grab bar in the tub and excellent housekeeping. On the outside there is well-maintained landscaping (boxwood borders all around). Thoughtfully arranged breakfast room with healthful choices and cute French-bistro-style cane and bentwood chairs. The place was full when I arrived back at the end of a concert event - word gets around.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review.

Summary: This hotel is not pet friendly- and it is not friendly to people who book on Expedia.  I know cause I did.  They reserve their "Value (bad) rooms" for people who book on Expedia.  These rooms are right next to traffic and are smaller than other rooms.  The guy at the front desk told me they have a whole area of "Value rooms" they set aside just for people who book on Expedia!  To me this is outrageous and unfair!!!  If you do want to stay at this hotel, call them and book directly.  And if you have someone you're visiting in Leisure World and tell them so, they say they'll even give you a special discount.
Manager Response: We apologize for any miscommunication on our part to this guest concerning our rooms with Expedia.  Expedia is given inventory for our "Standard" rooms which differ from our "Value" rooms only by location on the grounds -- distance from the pool, fitness center, Front Desk and shopping center.   Both room types are the same size, decor, etc.  We love Expedia and are ranked among the top 25 hotels in all of Orange County by Expedia.  Again, we sincerely apologize for any miscommunication on our part that misled this guest.

Summary Heading: Can't Beat It for the Price
Summary: This is a updated hotel that you can't beat for the price in this very convenient (more upscale) location.  I wasn't crazy about the toilet and bathtub being in a separate small room and the vanity outside the wall (but separated from the space where the beds are) but for 1 night, I won't complain.  They also have the usual complimentary breakfast that you find at many places these days.  For the price, you won't do better.
Manager Response: Jorden, we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: I appreciated the way staff took care of my room, which, by the way was excellent, and how they responded to my every need to assure me of a good stay.  Breakfast was served daily and offered a great variety of food and wonderful service.  Staff were friendly, caring and responsive to my every request.  Computers were also available to search for directions to places to see as well as to keep up with personal e-mail files.  The buildings were beautiful with flowers everywhere.  I can't think of anything negative to say about my stay.  It was wonderful!
Manager Response: Thank you for the five star review.

Summary: We wanted a non-chain hotel for our long weekend in SoCal, so I booked the Laguna Hills Lodge based on the many positive TripAdvisor reviews. I could not have been more pleased with our experience, especially for the price! The location (just off the 5) was perfect for us, as we wanted a location central to our day trips to area beaches, Palm Springs, and San Diego. Check-in was quick and painless and made extra-special with freshly baked cookies. After unpacking, my husband had to get his fish taco fix at Rubio's, so we made the easy walk across the street to the Laguna Mall. I did not use the pool nor the hot tub, but my husband pronounced them "just fine." We both made use of the fitness room, which came equipped with two incline treadmills, a cycle, and a circuit weight
Manager Response: "Fantastic Experience", says it all - Thank You!

Summary: We've now stayed here on 2 separate occasions and love it.  Its not a new hotel but very well kept up.  Basic breakfast but does the job.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.

Summary: Looking for a cozy place that won't break your budget? Stay here. It's close to some great restaurants and feels more like a resort. Very quiet and safe. Great for families. Find a guy named Roland. Super nice dude. He'll take good care of you.
Manager Response: "Great place to stay", many thanks for your review.

Summary Heading: The good, the bad and the ?
Summary: OK, for the good, close to where we were going which was to visit my aunt, also the price was right. The bad, noise from the traffic, close to busy road. The ?, noisy neighbors, not the motels fault, small room for breakfast, the continental breakfast was about average for a mid range motel. Would I stay here again, maybe, but I would check out other hotels/motels in the area first. .......one last thing, easy access to I-5
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: One of the nicest motels you'll ever stay in
Summary: Note that I state "motel" as this property isn't a hotel. Some might be concerned about the fact that even though it has internal corridors, anyone can access them. However, the area seemed very safe so not really an issue.  Breakfast was basic but nice, rooms were fantastic just as nice as good 3* properties. Bathroom was compact with a 3/4 length bath. TV great with 60 channels! Service on the front desk was fine but could have been a little more welcoming upon first arrival. Made use of the heated pool, again a great bonus in the winter.  As some have mentioned, there is a fire station right across the street with very loud fire engines departing quite regularly between 7am and 10pm but didn't hear anything during the night. Traffic noise was minimal.  Generally a great stay
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review.

Summary: Stayed at this "lodge" which is basically a motel for two nights. The furnishings in the room were a little dark but it was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Would use it again if required without question. We were in block B and next to the main road but there was no noise at all. We were able to park right outside our room which is not possible for all rooms. Complimentary continental breakfast was available but we chose to walk 200 yards to Carrows for a cooked one and claimed the 15% discount for Laguna Hills Lodge residents without problems. Another plus is good FREE wifi in your room. As the Brits say:- It does what it says on the tin. Should add there was a bath tub and also fridge, freezer and microwave in the room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review score of 4 out of 5.

Summary Heading: thoughtful staff follow-up even BEFORE my stay
Summary: Given all the great reviews here & elsewhere, I made an online reservation for later this month via the Laguma Hills Lodge website.  I took the "Value Two Queen" room (I'm on a budget) and added in the requests section, "Just a quiet, clean room with a firm bed and a helpful staff. Thank you."  The day after receiving my confirmation, I got a call from Roland (reservations staff).  Given my comments, he clarified that the "Value Two Queen" room is located on the side of the building where there can be some street noise during rush hours.  (We discussed it and, honestly, it doesn't sound like much noise at all.  It's basically a residential area with little traffic after 11 pm or before 8 am.  As a night owl, that doesn't affect me.)  With no other rooms at the same discounted
Manager Response: Hi Elaine, thank you for recognizing our staff!.  We look forward to seeing you soon ^_^.

Summary: Business trip and stayed here for 5 days. Rooms open to the parking lot and there are no enclosed hallways which might be a security complaint especially amoung single women travelers. I felt completely safe and liked parking right outside my door! Service at the front desk was average. Should be a little more friendly and smile but it wasn't bad service. Maids did a great job every day and got it done early. Rooms are very nice and very clean. Nice shower and towels.  Sink area lights were too bright but I just unscrewed two of the four bulbs until I left. Refrigerator has a good size freezer which is a very nice amenity for longer stays. Pool area was small but nice. Not a very quiet area but okay, lot of traffic noise and there is a Fire Station across the street from Bldg C
Manager Response: Thank you for your recommendation!

Summary Heading: excellent stay at Laguna Hills Lodge
Summary: Wonderful stay at the hotel, room size, comfortable bed, microwave, coffee pot in room, modern bathroom plus more!  The room was ultra clean and pleasant, and the breakfast was more than I expected.  I would definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: Thank you for the review score of 5 out of 5.

Summary: We just returned from a four night stay at the Laguna Hills.   It is a well maintained property with lovely gardens and a nice pool area.  It has a very comfortable feel to it  The breakfast is free and more than adequate.  We faced the courtyard which seems to be the quietest area but other rooms are very close to the highway.  We at times could hear the traffic, etc. The front desk staff are extremely nice and helpful.  Not a negative but get confirmation in writing - we were promised a free upgrade to garden and then were charged more.  May have been a misunderstanding  but get email conf.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review.

Summary: My husband & I stayed here 2 nights over New Year's eve.  We had several incidents during our stay.  Within the first couple of hours after our arrival the police had pulled a number of people into the parking lot from off the street.  They then proceeded to question them at length, handcuff and cart them off.  This happened more than once.  When my husband went to the front desk to ask why they allowed the police to use their parking lot they shrugged and basically had a :what do you want us to do about it" attitude.  My husband went to the police and asked them to please stop using the hotel parking lot, and they did. The gentleman at the front desk was very argumentative and combative when another member of our family who had booked a room there also was locked out of her
Manager Response: Thank you for submitting a review about your recent stay at the Laguna Hills Lodge.  We do apologize for the difficulties you experienced.    Regarding the police presence, a non-guest was in the process of being cited and pulled into our parking lot.  This said, the police should not have disturbed you.  We are sorry that you were subjected to this.    Regarding the dog owner who violated our â€œNo Pets Policyâ€ in the worst way, he has been given the significant fine which we levy when this policy is violated and a prime spot on our â€œUnwelcome Guestâ€ list.  I was glad to hear our staff offered to relocate you to a quiet room but fully understand that you did not want to move because you were already settled in.  We sincerely apologize for this problem.  Jean or Octavia will contact you to provide a follow up resolution to your concerns.  We strive for a 100% satisfaction and always work to ensure our guests have a very positive experience at the Laguna Hills Lodge.  Bill Crawford, General Manager Laguna Hills Lodge

Summary: I read all the reviews on the sites about this place being the "Hidden Gem" and I have to agree! We were down with 2 children and the service was amazing! The breakfast was good with pastries,cereals, fruit, etc and the swimming pool and hottub were very clean. There is a small exercise room with new equipment as well. The rooms were cleaned everyday before we got back with fresh towels. Our toilet got stuck one day ( the flusher) so I called the front desk and the repair guy showed up in about 2 seconds. I have to say that I was completely impressed at the service from everyone at the hotel. We will be back for sure! The location is just off the main highway and close to everything. There is a mall across the street as well as grocery store and plenty of restaurants just down
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review score of 5 out of 5, please come back soon ^_^.

Summary: We were only here for 1 night but will be back for sure next time we visit the area.  It was wonderful having so much with in walking distance. the Laguna Hills Mall is directly across the street there are several choices for food in the mall area.  The room was very clean and well kept. Generally a quiet place at least during our visit. The pool was heated even though it's January. The hot tub was wonderful as well. There is a small fitness room looked fine I didn't use it. The people at the front desk were very friendly and informative. We enjoyed the fresh cookies at check-in and the bowl of candies on the counter was a nice treat. Breakfast was good a large selection of cereals, breads, bagels. Hard boiled eggs and yogurt for proteins. The coffee was wonderful! All in all a
Manager Response: "Great value, Super location", thank you for your review.

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights during the summer we had 2 rooms with connecting doors which was great for us. The staff were friendly and the rooms were clean. The location was ok as we went to Disney and San diego to sea world . The best thing about it was the fact that it included breakfast which with 2 little ones really helped.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us ^_^.

Summary: We have just finished a 2 month trip around the US and Canada and this was the best place we stayed at by a million miles just in terms of comfort, quiet and value.  It was so relaxing, which is surprising as it is right by busy traffic and across from a mall, but has great sound proofing.    The room was large and comfortable.  The hotel information was great - lots of ideas of places to eat which is handy when you don't know the area and are tired and hungry.  (Would recommend the elephant bar over the road for great, healthy food and nice drinks and friendly staff too).  The nicest thing about this place was the breakfast.  The staff are really nice and efficient with everything.  It is incredibly clean and well thought out.  There isn't any hot food but all the choices are
Manager Response: "Excellent, and great value", thank you for your headline!

Summary Heading: NICE HOTEL AT A GOOD PRICE
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and paid Â£220 for bed and breakfast. Room was large with an essential fridge and microwave. Bed was very comfortable. Free wi-fi in room which is unusual for a hotel at this price. The breakfast was great. It was served in polystyrene (cups, plate, and bowl) with plastic cutlery but hey, it was free. If you are looking for a luxury break you will be disappointed. However, if you are looking for a comfortable and affordable hotel you won't get any better at this price. Also, location wise is fantastic. You can walk across road to the mall, and there is a good pizzeria/bar across the street. Will stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you  for the five star review.

Summary: I had a work event in Laguna Beach and needed an affordable hotel. We usually stay on Laguna Beach, but we had a stricter budget this year and I was worried we would have to compromise on hotel standards. After checking other reviews, I chose the Laguna Hills Lodge for me and my husband. The grounds are very pretty and well manicured. The rooms are nicely appointed, which was a surprise given the great rate we paid. We didn't eat the breakfast as we needed to get going, and we appreciated the locale of the hotel as we had many choices. I would recommend this hotel as the rates are very good without compromising on room standards. We were very pleased with this experience and will probably come back with our kids the next time we are in the area.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the review score of 5 out of 5!

Summary: The guy at the front desk was by far the rudest, most argumentative person. He literally argued with us in the lobby as we were checking in. After reading good reviews we thought this would be a great place to stay. Wrong!! I have never been so insulted. So much for a nice stay in laguna hills and paying for hospitality. Think again before staying here!!!
Manager Response: "Friendly staff" is the #2 compliment the hotel receives in over 4,000 online reviews, "clean" is #1.  Thank you for your review.

Summary: Really fantastic hotel -it's a gem. So many god things to mention: neet and spacy room, Nice poolarea, great breakfast and of cause very friendly staff. Will come again and will surely recommend to anybody going to Orange County.
Manager Response: "A perfect Gem", thank so much for your review ^_^.

Summary: We just stayed in this motel for a week and it was an extremely pleasant experience. Our room was very clean, the beds were comfortable. Everything worked. The continental breakfast isn't the best I've had but is somewhat above average. The fruit (apple, bananas and grapes) was fresh. A decent variety of bagels & toast, yogurt, hard boiled eggs.   The lodge is right across the street from the Laguna Hills Mall, which is small but adequate for basic needs. The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf cafe is in this mall and is about a 5-minute walk for those who need something with a little more body than motel coffee. There are several restaurants within walking distance. BJs is great, as is The Elephant Bar.   The exterior of the lodge is well-kept and charming with rose gardens and blooming
Manager Response: Thank you for all of your great feedback, come back soon ^_^.

Summary Heading: An amazing non franchise place to stay
Summary: Worth every penny and more.  Close to shopping, food and major freeways, but still hidden away that you don't notice the hustle and bustle.  Clean rooms, friendly staff, adequate free breakfast to start your day.  Pool and laundry area are extremely clean and well taken care of.  Meeting room has access to 2 computers and printers for use free if you need.  Can't say enough about how well taken care of the grounds are. If you do stay, ask for a garden room.  We asked for a second floor room with a balcony, and being able to step out and overlook the fountain and gardens is well worth the price.........
Manager Response: Many thanks for your great review and feedback!

Summary: We booked four rooms for our family getaway. One of the family members was not placed adjacent to the other rooms, and he was next to the stairway. He checked in at about 2:00pm and immediately placed his luggage in the room and then we all went to our destination. When we returned at night, my son did not even open his luggage and ttry and sleep as the noice from children yelling and running up and down the stairs was terrible. He went and complained to the front desk but the person was uncaring and said "what do you want me to do call the police?" No, all he could have done was go back with my son to the room and talk to the parents and children or have another employee do so. Instead, my son had no choice but to check out, never really using the room (except to hold his
Manager Response: Manager response to Guestâ€™s e-mail of 8/21/11, sent on 8/22/11:  First and foremost allow me to apologize on behalf of the Laguna Hills Lodge for any inconvenience.  Regarding your request for early check-in, I am sorry that we were unable to accommodate your request to check-in at 2:00 PM. We did get you in at 2:28 PM but are sorry you felt unhappy with our Front Desk staff. Let me assure you that we make every effort to accommodate requests for early check-in.   The weekend you stayed with us the hotel was sold out.  Many guests leave later than our check-out time of 11:00, especially during the summer, and our housekeeping staff has to work around this  As far as our Front Desk not seeming sensitive to your request, I apologize for that and have coached them. During the summer rush, people on both sides of the desk can be cranky. That is no excuse for you to have felt that your request was not worthy of a more sympathetic response.  Brian at our Front Desk apologized to your son when he reported children making noise in the stairway near his room. Let me also apologize. Because of this noise problem we are more than happy to reduce your sonâ€™s room charge by 50%.   Ironically, your son checked out of the Lodge at 9:30 PM, our staff checked the stairway at 10:00 PM and at 11:00 PM and there was no noise or children in the area.  We had to charge something for his room because we were unable to sell it to anyone else during this busy time.  Again, let me apologize for any inconvenience you experienced as a result of your stay at the Laguna Hills Lodge.   Regards,  Bill Crawford, Owner/Manager Laguna Hills Lodge

Summary Heading: Will make this our corporate hotel
Summary: We just consolidated our operations in Laguna Hills and had a board meeting at our new facility this week. Laguna Hills Lodge is a quaint motel with charm. This is not your run of the mill motel. Across the street is a major shopping mall complete with major department stores and outstanding restaurants. We ate at King's Seafood and highly recommend it.   We were greeted with big smiles and warm cookies. Facility offers a nice pool area and workout room. Rooms were complete with a refrigerator, a microwave, coffee maker, an iron and ironing board, a security vault, and free WiFi. Rate included a full continental breakfast and free newspapers. Business center included computers and printers.   Board members from Northern California, China, and the U.K. stayed at Laguna Hills
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review score of 5 out of 5.  We appreciate your business!!

Summary: Picked the Laguna Hills Lodge because of generally positive reviews on Trip Advisor. Was there for a short business trip and would stay there again. Very quaint and staff is very attentive. Rooms are nice, clean and for the price, you can't beat it. Lots of shopping nearby. Only minor complaints are that it's hidden away in a very busy shopping, residential & bustling area. Not alot of great choices for walking nearby, not very pedestrian-friendly, but hey, it's Southern California! When I walked the morning I was there, I got brusquely chased out of a gated area, which was anything but welcoming. My room looked out on busy side street so it was pretty noisy in the morning and there must be a fire station nearby as I heard several fire trucks. Continental breakfast was pretty
Manager Response: Thanks so much for staying with us!

Summary: Our stay, July 20 &21, 2011, here was great. Clean rooms, wonderful location (across the street from a shopping center and great coffee speciality shop)  and great breakfast! Great selecion of breakfast type foods - boiled eggs, cereal (including raisin bran), various fruits and yogurts and breads/muffins and more. The staff was helpful when needing directions and answering questions.
Manager Response: Many thanks for your recommendation!!

Summary Heading: Mello, easy and a good price.
Summary: We have stayed at the Laguna Hills Lodge several times over the past couple of years. Never have we had a bad experience so I would have to say it's a lot of bang for the buck since it is in one of the more expensive areas of the West Coast. It's convenient to most of the Southern Ca. attractions if that's your thing. For us it is the beach with the closest being 15 min. south and west to the Salt Creek/Strands area. Laguna Beach is a little closer but the traffic in the canyon can take some time if not done at the proper time of day. Of course once you get there and are lucky enough to find parking the wonderful free tram system in the summer up and down the Laguna coast is great and makes it generally worth the hassle. Now that our son is attending college at the nearby Soka
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for a great price!
Summary: Stayed at the lodge for 11 nights, choose this hotel according to the reviews and because price. Rooms were very clean staff very friendly. Breakfast room was clean and staff helpful, nice selection of food also. Pool was great for kids and open until 11pm. Would defiantly recommend this hotel to anyone. A wonderful time was had by all and even a shopping mall in walking distance who could ask for more!!
Manager Response: "Great hotel.....", thank you for your comments!!

Summary Heading: All value-priced hotels should be like this one
Summary: I generally stay in chain hotels, because I've found that independently-owned properties can sometimes be poorly-run, but I chose to stay here largely because of the very positive TripAdvisor reviews.  Thankfully, it was a good decision.    Every interaction I had with the staff was positive -- people were unusually friendly.   The cookie at check-in is a nice touch.  Even though the property is older, my room looked like it was recently updated.  The flat-screen TV was great.  I also really appreciated the free parking and free continental breakfast.  The breakfast isn't particularly elaborate, but there are cereals, pastries, yogurt, and more.  It's enough.  And it's free!  The hotel is also located conveniently off of I-5, making it easy to get everywhere in Orange County.
Manager Response: Many thanks for staying with us, we look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Absolutely loved it will be back next summer
Summary: My husband and I stayed 16 nights at the Lodge and enjoyed every minute of it. The staff were very welcoming after our long trip over from the UK. Room was perfect size for us nice large king bed clean linens, towels changed every day and rooms cleaned well. Facilities as in gym and free WIFI were brilliant, Pool was clean and well kept, poolside showers and toilets immaculately clean. Handy residents laundry facilities. Breakfast had plenty of choice in healthy options perfect to set us up for the day. Situated in a lovely safe area near to freeways, malls and beach towns. We were worried about possible noise from freeway but heard none, we stayed in building C next to Paseo da Valencia but had no road noise issues at all. Gardens are kept beautifully and give the property a
Manager Response: Hi Alison: Glad you liked your stay, we look forward to seeing you next summer ^_^.

Summary: A true Botique Hotel.  We found the people at the front desk to be very personable and accommodating.  In spite of being Freeway Close it is extremely Quiet.  A gorgeous pool and Sauna.  A fantastic Continental Breakfast with great choices far and above the typical Continental.  A fantastic all around great experience and we will be back before long for a pleasure trip and not business.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked a bank of 15 rooms at the Laguna Hills Lodge for my daughter's wedding in July. Everyone who stayed here was complimentary and pleased with the accomodations. They commented on the helpful staff, pleasant grounds, accessibility to freeway and shopping, breakfast, pool, laundry room, etc.  Thanks very much for making our family and friends feel at home by going the extra mile in offering a suitable rate, giving out welcome bags, keeping reservations current, and acknowledging the newlyweds with a rose bouquet from the garden!  We'll certainly recommend you to our future out-of-town guests.
Manager Response: We love taking care of wedding guests at the Lodge and your family and friends were a delight!  We truly are honored when guests choose us for such a special occasion.  The fresh-picked  rose bouquet for the bride was arranged by Liliana, one of our awesome guestroom staff.  She does a great job!  Thanks so much for your kind words,  Bill Crawford, Owner/Manager, Laguna Hills Lodge

Summary: This hotel has the worst customer service of any hotel I have ever had the displeasure of dealing.  I made a reservation through Priceline.com 10 days prior to staying here and my sole request was for a non-smoking room as my daughter has asthma.  The customer service/reservation person (Roland Balawan) told me in a very rude email that there is no way they could give me a non-smoking room and that I need to go back to Priceline and request a new hotel.  I understand if they are told on short notice but 10 days isn't enough notice in a non-sold out hotel?  Orange County has long been known as an area where they care only about money and not customer service and this reinforces that notion.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We looked into your reservation and confirmed with Priceline that it was for a smoking room (we have 6 smoking rooms - out of 121 rooms - grouped together in one building).  We also verified that the hotel was sold out of non-smoking rooms at the time you requested a move from a smoking to a non-smoking room.  We apologize for any rudeness by Roland.  Roland has a reputation for being very courteous and we assure you that his intent in referring you to Priceline was to help with a solution using the company you selected.  Please feel free to call the Lodge and ask for Jean if you would like to discuss your stay further.  Bill and Pat Crawford, Owners/Managers, Laguna Hills Lodge

Summary Heading: Very pleasant and very good value
Summary: Stayed one night to put daughter in college.  Older property but well kept.  Perfectly clean inside room, well kept grounds and common areas out.  Didn't try sauna or pool but I'm sure they'd be on par.  Breakfast was well presented and had all you'd want.  A bit of hallway noise comes thru the door but since I'm not paying four-star-soundproofed-prices I figure it was acceptable.  Would stay again.  Would have liked a blankie so I could have ramped up the AC at night but my guess is that it would have been made available if I'd asked.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review.

Summary: This hotel is beautiful outside with their flowers and little garden area.  It is close to malls, the beach, and nice restaurants. It is a quiet stay and the rooms are updated. Very clean and kept up. The hotel desk was nice and helpful when asked questions. The breakfast was good but nothing spectacular. Overall I would recommend this hotel and stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for recognizing our remodeling!!

Summary Heading: Knew we'd love it, loved it, we'll stay there again
Summary: Seems like there aren't too many of these privately owned places worth staying at anymore. This one certainly met and exceeded my expectations. The price was very good, the location excellent, the rooms very clean, the grounds very nice, and a feeling a privacy and safety, without feeling like you couldn't get assistance if you needed it.  The website is an accurate representation of the the property in every way. I have already recommended it to several friends and family, and I can't wait to have a reason to go back! We really enjoyed meeting and talking with the other guests at the pool area. We found this to be a perfect place for 2 adults and a 7 year old. We stayed in Suite 202 and it was absolutely what we needed. We loved the continental breakfast every morning right on
Manager Response: We look forward to seeing you again soon!  Thanks for staying with us!!

Summary: we stayed four nights here last month.  it is excellent value for money.  very clean, free breakfast, free wifi, free parking - that's hard to find in California !  don't think that it's really close to the beach because it's not but it is close to the freeway so an excellent base for sightseeing. the swimming pool looked lovely, we didn't even have time to use it because we were out and about all the time
Manager Response: Thank you for the review score of 4 out of 5.

Summary Heading: The Family Gathered for a Wedding at Laguna Hills Lodge!
Summary: My wife and I decided to get married on Laguna Beach and make it a destination wedding for our immediate family.  28 people converged on Laguna Hills Lodge.   Roland, Martin and the rest of the staff at Laguna Hills Lodge treated us like ROYALTY!  Greated at the desk by friendly staff and a tasty Chocolate Chip Cookie when we first arrived was the best!!  Every wish we had came true and while we didn't have super unreasonable needs, the staff did everything they could to accomdate us.  The pool area has a GREAT patio/deck where we hosted a pre-wedding night dinner for the entire family.  We brought in food/beverages (no glass bottles of course!) and a few simple decorations.  It was PERFECT.   Beyond that - the rooms were not only clean and comfortable, but they had all the
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear how happy your family and friends were staying at the Lodge for such an important family occasion.  We are honored you chose us..  BTW, our staff all enjoyed how much fun your group was having and loved taking care of you!  Thanks for sharing your experience.  Bill Crawford, Owner/Manager, Laguna Hills Lodge

Summary: Upon first arriving at the hotel, I was disappointed because it's nothing special.  The room was plain, the door stopper fell off the door and the sliding mirror closet door fell off the track.  The breakfast is plain, just bagels, cereal, and yogurt.  I would definitely stay for the price, but know that it's 7 miles from the beach, so you'll have to drive to the beach and pay between $10-20 for parking each time.  Other than that, it was fine.  It was quiet and clean, and we had a great time in the pool, which was small, but was 8 feet deep, so we were able to jump and dive in.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a review.  We apologize for any "mechanical difficulties" you had in your room.
