It's frustrating for us, too, because we have so recently remodeled the hotel.  Fortunately, Alberto, our head of maintenance (and everybody's favorite fellow in the Mariposa Room!) and his staff are happy to take care of these annoyances for our guests.   Just alert the Front Desk and they'll send help ASAP.  Bad news:  Beach parking is expensive; good news:  Parking is free at the Lodge!  Bill Crawford, owner/manager, Laguna Hills Lodge

Summary Heading: Outstanding Hotel, and has been for four decades...
Summary: I've stayed at the Laguna Hills Lodge for nearly four decades.  Over that time the staff have changed, but the hotel remains an outstanding value.  It is invariably spotlessly clean, well-furnished, quiet, with manicured grounds, a very clean and delightful swimming pool...in short a perfect place for both the business traveler (which I was when I first discovered it), and  a recreational visitor.  It is astonishingly cheap compared to many other hotels in the area, and is perfectly located right off Hwy 5 (just below the Hwy 5 and Hwy 405 junction), by El Toro Blvd which runs straight down to the Laguna Canyon road.  Don't miss this--just a great place!
Manager Response: "Outstanding hotel",  thank you for your feedback ^_^.

Summary Heading: What does everyone like so much? I'm confused...
Summary: The only thing that I can think is that many of the past reviewers must not travel much. This hotel is adequate, but far from superior as some have reported. The landscaping is very nice and well cared for. The staff seems to be pleasant. The location is easy on/ easy off the freeway. The hotel is within a 5 minute walk of many restaurants and a large mall. The breakfast is an average continental style breakfast. The rooms and buildings are old and in serious need of repair and sprucing up. Many areas have chipped paint, the rooms are 1970's decor, the internet connection is misnamed as "high speed", and really nothing too special about this place. The lodge seemed clean but a little pricey for what you get. Although it is located in a pricey area which would explain the cost.
Manager Response: Thanks for your comments on our hotel. To answer your question ("What does everyone like so much?"), customers most frequently comment on our value (attractive room rates), the cleanliness of rooms, the friendliness of staff, our gardens and pool and the convenience of the restaurants and shops.  Regarding our "70s room decor",   a total remodel was completed in 2009.  Concerning our past reviewers who "must not travel much" we have enjoyed seasoned travelers from all over the US, Europe, Asia, South America, Australia, Canada and Africa.  Meeting these wonderful guests is the greatest pleasure in owning a hotel!  Bill Crawford, Owner/Manager, Laguna Hills Lodge

Summary Heading: Great for visiting elders in Laguna Woods Village
Summary: Best things: the Business Center with free fast computers & printers; substantial breakfast selections served in a lovely room with attendant -- open from 7-10. Mall with Macy's, Sears, & Nordstrom Rack within 2 blocks. Lots of restaurants too. The hotel is convenient to I-5 and easy to find.  Prices are in line with southern California -- not cheap, but good value.     Windows open. Rooms are clean, but they do use Febreze on the carpet after vacuuming. Hall carpets look stained, and if you are a neat freak this might turn you off.  Fire station across the street could bother, especially if you are in rooms on the nw side, mostly Bldg C, and a light sleeper.
Manager Response: Thank you for the five star review!

Summary: The best breakfast , loved it, clean and garden was beautifull, For sure we'll be back!
Manager Response: "The best breakfast, loved it, clean....".  Thank you for your feedback and for the great review ^_^.

Summary: Been here one day out of 5 and found the services and staff just as others have commented on and deserving of #1. Bath room was spotless. Room was clean. Continental breakfast was simple  but fresh. Nice touch was that there were lots of electronic  opening doors. Have 2 days later at the St. Regis and hope the service and staff are just as good.
Manager Response: "Great value', thank you for your feedback.

Summary Heading: Feels like an Oasis in the City
Summary: Sit at the pool and you won't believe you are in the middle of a busy city!  I was completely satisfied with our stay.  I arranged special rates for a 90th birthday party for relatives (Roland was very helpful).   The staff is helpful, the rooms were clean, the breakfast room was nice.  I'll stay here any time I need a hotel near there.  The desk clerk suggested we could use the larger table in the pool area if we wanted to get together with our other visiting relatives.  The pool area was nice and quiet and the fitness room is off the pool area.  As I understood it, here are value rooms (the cheap rates on Orbitz., near the fire station), standard rooms, and garden rooms (I think they have balconys over looking the "garden" between the buildings; even with chairs.)  There was a
Manager Response: Loved the headline "...oasis in the city...".  We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: we enjoyed it here.  Comfortable bed,clean and nice room and I liked the pool area. The reception and breakfast staff were polite and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business!

Summary: A decent hotel. It has the basic amenities that you need. Beds were comfortable. Toiletries can use some improvement. Extended breakfast is nothing more that a continental breakfast with boiled eggs. Nice garden. Quiet area, close to shopping. Had a good night sleep. A little pricey compared to other hotels with the same amenities.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We were happy that you mentioned our toiletries because we are currently in the process of upgrading them.  We are fortunate that Octavia, one of our associates has expertise in this area and we had a group of very picky women slather on body lotion and sniff wonderful scents from green tea to citrus.  We also learned a trick of the trade.  In between different scents, we cleansed our nasal passages by sniffing coffee beans.  It really works and we think all of our guests will enjoy our new products.   Pat Crawford

Summary Heading: Our stay at the Laguna Hills Lodge was as close to perfection as you can get.
Summary: Staff greeted us on arrival with courtesy & efficiency on late check-in  (we called ahead to advise of this). The quiet room on the 3rd floor we requested was clean, spacious, well laid-out and extremely well-appointed. Location was perfect, as it was a 5 minute drive to the home of people with whom we were visiting, & close to a wide range of shops and services. Continental breakfast was ample & excellent. Booked the room through hotels.com & were completely satisfied .
Manager Response: Thank you for the five star review!

Summary Heading: Very pleasant well run hotel with excellent amenities.
Summary: From the moment of check in to check out this hotel makes you feel welcome. The room was clean and comfortable,  very nice accommodations for breakfast and a business center with computer and printer.  This was my fifth visit and would definitely return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The gardens and lanscaping at the hotel were beautiful.  The staff was friendly and effective.  They were very good at enforcing smoking to a limited area.  The continental breakfast was first rate and in a comfortable setting.  The motel is close to shopping and dining and some discounts were offered to Laguna Hills Lodge patrons. Dana Point with its excellent whale watching tours was within a half hour as was the historic  mission at San Juan Capistrano. Laguna Beach was a short trip.  It is an excellent location with east access to I 5, I 405, and I-73(toll road).  The rooms were comfortable and quiet.  I liked the free internet to get my boarding passes.  Basically a great stay at a reasonable rate.
Manager Response: "A Beautiful Hotel",  thank you for staying with us!!

Summary Heading: We were upgraded to a garden room suit for being guest of the day!
Summary: All the details in the hotel were perfect!  The employees make you feel right at home.  A nice cozy clean room with a spotless heated pool, spa, and SAUNA! The fitness room had the necessities for cardio and  weight barring exercises. The breakfast was lovely as well.  A perfect hotel for a vacation to forget about all the stresses of life. :)
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review, we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: While looking for a chain to stay at while in SoCal, I serendipitously stumbled across Laguna Hills Lodge.  The staff are friendly and accomodating, the room was pleasant as well as comfortable.  The grounds are beautiful and well maintained.  I highly recommend it!
Manager Response: Thanks for the review score of 4 out of 5 ^_^.

Summary Heading: Great one night stay.  Would have liked to stay longer.
Summary: Quiet room. Friendly staff (also gave us tasty cookies at check in). The microwave is hidden away which tricked us and forced us to ask them for another room, but when they realized why we went back and found the microwave.  The breakfast was good and there were lots of tables / chairs in the breakfast area unlike some other hotels with free breakfast.   Don't think there was an elevator to 2nd floor which is helpful when you have lots of luggage.
Manager Response: Thank you for your business!

Summary Heading: DO NOT USE THE INTERNET WHILE STAYING AT THIS PROPERTY
Summary: I recently had an incident where a man (dressed in plain clothes with nothing indicating he was an employee) came into the business center and asked me if I was a guest, if I knew whether the computers were secure or not. The man then proceeded to recite phrases and excerpts from personal and private emails I had just got through sending out! Thank God I did not use my credit card for any transactions while I was using one of the two computers the hotel provides.
Manager Response: The two computers in our Business Center are hardwired into our local internet provider, Cox Communications. When we consulted with our computer technicians they assured us that the only likely scenario in which this could possibly happen is if you used a web email program ie: gmail or yahoo mail etc and did not log out of your account when you was done.   As a reminder, we have signs posted next to the computers reminding guests to sign off.   Since our Business Center is adjacent to our Front Desk, we are puzzled as to why this guest did not come to us with his problem so we could have addressed his concerns.  A one-star review under the circumstances is unfair.

Summary: My sister, my mom, and I recently took a trip out to California to look at colleges for my sister. We decided to stay one night at the Laguna Hills Lodge and we absolutely loved it. The people who worked there were so nice. They gave us cookies at check in! The rooms were so cute. There was a sink outside the bathroom which allowed one of us to get ready, while the other showered, which was nice! After a long day of driving when we check in, we were able to use the heated pool and jacuzzi. We had the whole pool area all to ourselves, which was awesome! The next morning we had a nice complimentary breakfast. The staff working the breakfast room were very nice. Overall, this was the best hotel we stayed at while in CA, and we stayed at 4! So, if you're in the Laguna Hills area,
Manager Response: "Loved the Laguna Hills Lodge", thank you so much ^_^.

Summary: This hotel is nice and quiet and allows smoking. The reservation staff were very friendly and accomadating.  For those reasons I would stay there again. There were some areas needing improvement. The room had two small queen size beds. The interior was a little dim, needed better lighting. The housekeeping was a tad sloppy, dust on the counter tops and sloppily made beds, but everything else was very clean especially the carpet and bathroom.  I would give this hotel as a recommended place to stay for a smoker.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.

Summary: I stayed 2 nights at the Laguna Hills Lodge and because the rate was very good, I was afraid that the hotel would not live up to it's website.  The room was very comfortable, everything worked, and even though it was right on a busy street, the windows were soundproof. There was a complimentary breakfast in a nice dining room with an attendant. Staff was very pleasant and very helpful will directions of where to shop and eat. It is right across the road from Laguna Hills Mall,  several good restaurants and a major hospital within walking distance.  It is also very close to Laguna Woods which was formerly the Leisure World community so an excellent choice for lodging if you want to be close to there.
Manager Response: "Lovely, gracious hotel", many thanks for your review!

Summary: The Laguna Hills Lodge is excellent. The rooms are nice, beds comfortable, there was no noise when I was trying to sleep, the housekeeping is good, the shower and bathroom excellent. The breakfast was totally adequate and a wonderful plus. I don't often stay at less than 4-star hotels but the Laguna Hills Lodge, convenient to what I was doing in CA, was totally comfortable. I never wanted anything that wasn't provided.
Manager Response: "Excellent hotel", thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Laguna Hills
Summary: I stayed here for a week while visiting an elderly relative at Laguna Woods. Rooms are large and very clean and have free wi-fi.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  They even loaned us a screwdriver to take offsite so we could put bookshelves together for my aunt.  Property is beautiful and well maintained, free breakfast is great.  I stayed a few days by myself after other family members left, and I felt very safe, which is always important for solo female travelers.  Hotel is close to the I-5 which made it easy for area friends to find me.  I recommend this hotel very highly, and will stay here again when I have to return to the area.
Manager Response: Hello Ellen:  Thanks so much for your review, and headline "Great place to stay in Laguna Hills:.

Summary Heading: A very pleasant place to stay.
Summary: The Laguna Hills Lodge is a very pleasant place to stay.  Friendly, helpful staff.  Beautiful grounds.  Good continental breakfast.  Lots of nearby restaurants.  Near I-5, but tucked away and traffic noise is not objectionable.  Our only complaint is that the wireless internet was a little slow.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your five star review.

Summary: Centrally located, this hotel was a comfortable base to visit family and local attractions. Very good value for the money. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review rating of 5 out of 5.

Summary: I set up to stay here for an extended period of time (30 days). The staff was incredible, I would like to credit them with being courteous, kind, and flexible. The room was clean albeit a little bit small for my taste. Location is great, near the freeway, though the downside is you get some traffic noise.  Overall a great experience, the location is clean, safe, well furnished, beautiful external decor, staff is great, and I would recommend the place to others.
Manager Response: "Excellent room and service", BTW "friendly service" is the #2 compliment we receive, "clean" is #1 ^_^.

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.  Gorgeous landscaping, pretty rooms, nice pool, great breakfast.  The rooms were very clean, and the staff was friendly and helpful.  Highly recommend!
Manager Response: "Immaculate rooms", thank you for your feedback!!

Summary: I always inspect the beds that I will be staying in for bed bugs. Its becoming a nation wide nuisance.  So when I when I checked in I entered the room went to the bed and pulled back the matress from the box spring there were bed bugs crawling around. I informed the management and they were in denial and very argumentative about the situation.  I informed them that they can be transporting these insect home with all of there guest. Management called me back to tell me that the insects were carpet beatles. I am here to tell you that they were in fact bed bugs!  You decide.
Manager Response: A few minutes after checking in,  this  guest returned to the Front Desk and reported that he thought that he may have found bedbugs in his room.  Several staff members returned to the room with the guest immediately, checked the room and found no sign of bed bugs.  We did find three small white "balls".   We have never had bed bugs on our property.  The guest checked out.  We told him we would contact Orbitz for a refund.  We then had our pest control company, A Amazing Pest Control inspect the room.  MIchael (the owner of the company) assured us that the bugs this guest saw were definitely NOT bedbugs but  either a furniture or a carpet beetle.  You get rid of them with a vacuum which has been done.  We only had a few beetles which pest control says probable came from a bird's nest inside the roof tiles outside the window of the room. The nest has been removed.    We  called the guest and he seemed happy with our follow-up.  We offered him a free room which he said he would  use another time.  In the meantime we told him we would contact Orbitz for his refund.   We are sorry this guest was alarmed needlessly.  We understand everyone's anxiety about bedbugs (no one is more anxious that we are!) but as to the guest's assertion that you decide who to believe, we choose to believe the experts in pest control.

Summary: I spent 5 days at this hotel and will spend all of my future visits there.  The property is beautiful with flowers and fountain.  It's close to the freeway and to Laguna Beach.  The property and rooms are exceptionally clean.  The staff is exceptionally friendly.  The pool and spa area are relaxing and the temperatures are perfect.  They have on-site laundry facilities.  It's quiet and the rooms are very nicely appointed w. comfy bed.  And the rate includes a great breakfast.   I visit OC 2x/year.  I've stayed at 4 and 5 star hotels.  This one has been the most satisfying for my needs.  And it's quiet.  I was there when the temps exceeded 100 degrees and the room air conditioner didn't quite keep up -- but it was still great.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review score of 5 out of 5, please come back soon.

Summary: Great location, right off the 5. (But right next to the fire station. Beware middle of the night sirens.) Close to shopping, restaurants. Older but clean. Rooms are smaller than I'm used to at the chain hotels but are well-equipped. Toiletries were not replenished at all during our 5 night stay and the promised daily newspaper never materialized.  Pretty landscaping with lots of flowers. "Garden view" rooms are $15 extra. Overall very convenient to OC locations and a good value with the included continental breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very pleasant stay.  We paid a little bit more for a courtyard room, and had a view of a beautiful little garden with a burbling fountain.  Rooms were very fresh and tidy, but please remember to wipe off the condensation above the shower and the back of the bathroom door... Beds were on the firm side, but comfy. Breakfast was adequete, but either they don't serve on the weekends or we missed it somehow (we didn't ask, because it wasn't a big deal to us). The people at the desk were pleasant and effiencient, the location was quiet and seemed quite tucked away, considering that the freeway easy to access. I would absolutely stay here again, and would book a courtyard room again.
Manager Response: We look forward to your next visit ^_^.

Summary: This hotel is excellent value for money. Everything was fine. The room was very clean and very good size. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpfull. The pool was very nice. We would go again
Manager Response: Love the headline "Excellent" ^_^.

Summary: Because I am budget minded, I did my research on Trip Advisor to find a good budget hotel/motel not too far from downtown Laguna Beach. The Laguna Hills Lodge was so much more than I expected. About 15-20 minutes (scenic drive) from downtown Laguna Beach, this family owned lodge was very reasonably priced, clean beyond words, the room we had was HUGE with beautiful furnishings and plenty of drawer and closet space. It also had a lovely pool and jacuzzi, business center and workout room. Across the street was a mall and there were many restaurants to choose from. Upon check-in, we were given coupons for some of them as well as the movie theatre. A very nice continental breakfast was served each morning. Though it was a ride into Laguna Beach, I would stay there again without any
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for staying with us!!

Summary: I can't get over having a maid knock on the door  then immediately walk in @ 9am.  We were yelling stay out but she still tried to open the door. Check out is @ 11am & the front desk would know that we are still in the room. The front desk said it is the policy & seemed amused. It just seems like they want you out of a room that is paid for until 11.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Barged in at 9AM & Mgmt laughed & said it was "Policy"
Summary: We were excited about staying at this quaint, but nicely updated hotel.  Then we were awakened by a knock on the door at 9 a.m. by the maid.  Even though we began yelling to stay out, she barged in on us in bed.  When we complained to management they laughed and told us it was there policy.  We won't be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent staff and crew with high quality of service, professional and very accommodating.
Summary: The hotel is clean, locating in a quiet but freeway access convenient location. The facility is definitely a great value find and very pleasant. Service and staff are excellent. I am particularly thankful for Mr.Roland, the service manager, and Ms.Marguerita, front office personel, who helped made our stay pleasant and possible.
Manager Response: "Excellent staff", thank you for recognizing our team!!

Summary Heading: Great little hotel in nice area with a good price!
Summary: I found this little gem by accident.  This motel was near an area where I wanted to stay.  I called them on the phone to book my reservation and they were very helpful.  The room was very nice.  The gardens were lovely.  Convenient location to interstate and other attractions.  And the price was reasonable.  I would not hesitate to recommend this motel to a friend or relative.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review score of 5 out of 5 ^_^.

Summary: My sister and I stayed here on the travel down to San Diego! It was a perfect find and for the price we paided it was excellent. Cookies when we arrived was lovely, Pool open until 11! No Noise, Resturants and Shopping mall in 2 minutes walk. Lovely, Would use again and again!.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to post a review score of 5.  We appreciate it!

Summary Heading: Great little hotel in a nice area
Summary: We stayed here on a visit to see my son in Aliso Viejo.   The rooms are a little on the small side, but the price made it affordable to rent two for our family of four. Beds were reasonably comfortable and the room was exeptionally  clean. Someone else mentioned unpleasant odors, but we didn't notice any.  Each of our rooms had two queen beds, refrigerator, microwave, and small safe. The safe had plenty of room for our small laptop and miscellaneous items we wanted to lock up.  Staff were fantastic - friendly and really helpful.   The free breakfast was great. There were a variety of cold cereals, coffee, tea, juice, fruit (apples, bananas, grapes when we were there), yogurt, muffins, hard-boiled eggs, bagels, etc. The hotel was full during our stay, and the dining room was
Manager Response: Thank you for your review nd headline "Great little hotel in a nice area".

Summary: This is a small hotel with simple extras like a good free breakfast every morning from 7-10a.m. Be aware while it is located by a nice mall and the restaurant across the street (BJ's) is amazing, the fire station is right behind the hotel, too. It didn't make a difference to us but others might be upset by the occasional noise.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed five nights at the Laguna Hills Lodge and rented two rooms, adjoining. I booked directly with the hotel and was very pleased with the service and the price. The hotel was very clean and the gardens around the buildings added a really nice touch. Rooms were nicely apppointed, very comfortable and really quiet. The pool was warm and very inviting, spent lots of time in it. When we first arrived the hot tub had a problem but it was fixed by the next day. The excercie room had two treadmills, a recumbent bike and weight machine all in good working order. The staff members were great, very helpful and accommodating, extra towels or blankets no problem,. Need a plate for your lunches it will be sent up. GREAT FOLKS.  If your going to be in the Laguna Hills, Laguna Woods area
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent value in a top property
Summary: This is best property I have found for the price in this area.  It is located close to Laguna Woods, shopping (and places to eat - they even have discount arrangements with several) and freeway access.  This is an older, but very nicely kept facility with very large rooms, good quality linens, toiletries, free WiFi and other room amenities.  The pool is heated, the work out room has good quality equipment that actually works and the service is friendly and professional.  Grounds are nicely landscaped and maintained. A free breakfast is included.  It is only a small cut above the standard continental fare - but the selection is adequate and for a quick bite at the beginning of the day, it's fine.  My stay was for several days and the per night cost was more reasonable then lower
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: an above average stay for a below average price
Summary: for $100 in the Laguna area, i wasn't expecting much. We just needed a decent place to stay for a night before heading to Catalina. We more more than pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean, bright, cheery and the breakfast, for continental, was pretty good. I'd definitely recommend it as a good value for the money.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After a busy 6 days in Hollywood we were looking for somewhere quiet to relax and unwind for a few days and Laguna Lodge was the ideal place. As you drive up to this Hotel, the first thing you notice are the colours. The Hotel is covered in the most beautiful cerise blooms. The gardens are just out of this world with a water feature in the middle and considering it is a stones throw from the main road, you get a feeling of peace! Our room and small balcony overlooked the garden. The first room we were given overlooked the road and car park so we asked if we could change our room and they were only too happy to oblige. The room was quite small but well furnished. I was with my husband and teenage daughter and there were 2 king size beds. A good sized fridge, coffee maker, flat
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel - Great Service - Great Price
Summary: Stayed a week in March.   We were very impressed.  Room was well appointed and clean.  Beautiful landscaping.  Pool & hot tub areas were clean & quiet.  Laundry room & work-out areas were small but clean & sufficient for our needs.  Great location, lots to do within walking distance.  Hotel staff went above & beyond.  They were courteous and very helpful.  Standard continental breakfast ( muffins, cereal, juice, coffee etc)  Nice coupon packet received upon check-in for local restaurants.  We stayed on the street side & it was still incredibly quiet & relaxing.  The location makes it a wonderful base for traveling through-out Southern CA.  Certainly plan to stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived in the early afternoon.  Check in was simple with a very polite and helpful lady who gave us directions to a local restaurant for dinner.  Our hotel room was spotless.  Although the buildings are a little older this hotel has updated and modernized every last corner.  Our room had a flatscreen t.v., marble countertops, and beautiful furnture with a mini-fridge and free digital lock safe.  The grounds have been landscaped by a real professional - flowers, shrubs, bushes are everywhere and kept in perfect condition.  To top it all off, we enjoyed a complimentry breakfast.  A REAL breakfast complete with chef cooking eggs, bacon, sausage - any way you want.  Cereal, fresh fruit, hot coffee, fresh bred.  The hotel is located directly adjacent to a main road, and sits near
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value.  Very clean and quiet.
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for one night while in town for a wedding.  I found the property to be exceptionally clean and well-maintained.  It had all the amenities you'd expect in a good hotel and the price was great.  It was also very quiet and the front desk staff was friendly.  My only complaint is that the mattress was very hard.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us!

Summary Heading: This stressed-out traveler can't find anything to complain about
Summary: We were planning to stay with family, only to find out on arrival that the guest room was unavailable due to construction.  We had driven past the Laguna Hills Lodge earlier in the day, and it looked pretty nice from the outside, so my wife suggested we check it out.  Margarita and Estee at the front desk went out of their way to get us the best room available, and I think they gave us a price break too.  They were nice enough to let us check out the room before we agreed to book it.  (We wanted to make sure we could hook up our Wii Fit to the TV set in the room.)  The room was clean and the mattresses were firm.  I started day two with an early morning visit to their Business Center to catch up on e-mail, and then strolled over to the building where they serve complimentary
Manager Response: Thank you for your review rating of 5 out of 5!

Summary: This may look like a budget motel, but it is far more satisfying.  Located just seconds from the I-5 Interstate at El Toro Road in Laguna Hills, the rooms are large and very clean, the staff friendly, the business center effective and the price more affordable than most budget motels located in neighborhoods you don't want to be in.  It's superbly located close to Irvine, Laguna Beach, Newport Beach, etc.  A true find for the business traveler!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review ^_^.

Summary: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel.  It is a mediocre hotel, definitely not a "5" in my book. The room was a  pretty basic  room.   The hotel is situated behind a store that has gone out of business and across the street from a large shopping mall. We had a room on the 2nd floor facing the courtyard, and it was quiet.  The beds were firm, not pillowtop and the pillows were flat foam.  There were not feather pillows available and there were no extra pillows or blankets in the room.  We went to the desk to get additional blankets and were told we could only have one, even though we had 2 beds in the room.  We insisted and they did end up giving us two blankets.  The bathroom was very small - 4ft. x 5ft, but there was a large vanity outside of the bathroom.   We checked out the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at our hotel.  As owners of the Laguna Hills Lodge, we really appreciate the opportunity to read comments from our guests as to what they like or may not like about our hotel.  We have no rebuttal to your thoughtful comments except for the continental breakfast  -- we have fresh seasonal fruits available every morning plus a large selection of bakery goods and breads toasted to order, coffee, tea in addition to the items you mentioned. We are in the process of adding even more items to our menu.  As to your difficulty obtaining extra blankets, we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.  That day we had an unusually high demand for extra blankets and were running low.  We have added extra blankets to our inventory to prevent this from ever happening again.  Thank you for alerting us to your experience.    During these difficult economic times, the goal we strive for is to offer the best quality for the best price.  As so many of our other guests on Trip Advisor have pointed out, we believe on the whole we deliver this.  Our family owned and operated hotel just completed a $3Million remodel last year and we look forward to the time when the economic recovery will allow us to add even more amenities, such as the niceties you mentioned.   In the meantime,  we again thank you for your remarks and the comments of our wonderful guests from all over the world who have enjoyed our hotel as we have enjoyed meeting and serving them.

Summary Heading: Wish Laguna Hills Lodge could be in every city in the USA
Summary: Accomodations/accoutraments were above excellent both in the room itself, and the surrounding grounds.   Areas kept extremely clean and would NOT hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone - either traveling alone or with a family.   Believe I was very fortunate to be able to stay in Laguna Hills Lodge for a week.
Manager Response: Hello Nancy:  Thanks so much for your five star review.

Summary: This was a wonderful surprise and a total bargain choice at $77 in a sea of over-priced OC hotels.  Located within walking distance of Mother's Market - for you vegetarians, and Carrows for the rest of you, there's comfort in knowing you don't need a car to get a bite to eat.  Every morning the hotel serves breakfast - oatmeal, fruit, cereal, coffee, tea. The microwave and fridge came in handy as I shopped at Mother's and ate in my room  to save a few bucks.  Just remember to turn your fridge ON when you arrive.  Room was clean, and elevator or steps get you to the second and third floors. Business center was set up great with desk, Eames-style chair and superfast internet which meant I didn't need to lug my computer on the airplane. If being across from the fire station bothers
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback, we do have a super location across the street from the mall and a short drive to Laguna Beach ^_^.

Summary Heading: Always a good place to stay
Summary: I have been staying at Laguna Hills Lodge on & off for 15 years.  They have recently redone the rooms & they are very nice.  The garden areas are well kept & flowers lovely. The staff is friendly and helpful. They have a good breakfast available.  Two years ago I was there for my mother's 100 birthday & they gave me lovely bouquet of roses to take to her.  f
Manager Response: Love your headline "Always a good place to stay".

Summary: I thought this place was great. It was my second time staying here while visiting relatives in Lake Forest. It is close to shopping and the highway. It had nice rooms that were surprisingly quiet. The really great thing about this place is the lovely landscaping that puts it way ahead of similar facilities and amenities. The flowers are lovely and one feels like you are staying in a park. The breakfast was nice and got you going in a positive way.
Manager Response: Regarding our landscaping we have 450 rose bushes ^_^.

Summary: The rooms were very nice and suited my needs perfectly, and the staff was very friendly and made me feel at home.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for staying with us and thank you for the great review!

Summary: We stayed 2 nights here prior to going to San Diego.  We chose this hotel based soley on a central  location to see the beach area around Laguna and Newport without spending a small fortune to be in on the beach.  This place is a little on the old side and could use some updating however, for the money spent compared to the other hotels in the area, it is a very good value.  The rooms were all you needed for coming back after a full day of sight seeing.  I would not plan a long term stay here but for a couple days I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean, convenient and quiet. Attractive property. Good breakfast.
Manager Response: Love your comment "Feels like home" ^_^.

Summary: Totally remodeled and very reasonable.  Quiet, close to I-5 and I-405.  What a bargain!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decent Motor Inn; Overstated Breakfast; Rude Manager
Summary: Stayed here for a few nights in August. Because I had no idea how long my business would keep me in California, I was looking for a place willing to negotiate a rate. Spoke with the manager, Martin, who agreed to take ten dollars off the room per night and put me in a room where I could stay "up to a week" if need be--at the same rate. So far, so good. On my second day there, Martin  asked me to move to a different room. When I reminded him of what he promised me, he claimed he had never spoken to me before and that I was confusing him with someone else who worked there. Unbelievable.   I was forced to leave my business meeting, drive twenty miles back to the motel and move my belongings to another room. (Had I had the time, I would have left in search of  more hospitable
Manager Response: We are, of course, very sorry that one of our guests has felt that he had a bad experience at the Lodge.  Our family has owned and operated the Laguna Hills Lodge for 40 years and the average length of employment of our dedicated staff is 14 years.   We would like to clarify a few issues for our guest and anyone who reads this.  Unfortunately, when this guest booked his room for one night with the request to stay an additional day or two as needed, our hotel was at nearly full occupancy.   Because of that, we were able to accommodate him but could not guarantee a 3-night stay in the same room.  As far as the price we quoted this guest, he was offered our lowest available rate.  We invite this guest to contact us directly if he needs to discuss this further. Lastly, this guest made an unpleasant comment about our â€œoverstatedâ€ breakfast.  We call our meal service an â€œextended continental breakfastâ€ because besides the usual offerings we add hard-boiled eggs, a large variety of yogurts and fresh seasonal fruits, bakery items toasted to order, etc.  We have never before received any complaints about our breakfast.  Indeed, guests compliment us on this meal served in our very attractive Mariposa Room.

Summary: I stayed here for 6 nights while in town for the Little League Regionals. It was a GREAT choice. Rooms were clean - service was great - breakfast was fine -and I loved having the hard boiled eggs also! Pool was great, nice shady areas. Even workout room was nice - overlooking the pool. Location was nice as it was right by the mall - definitly walking distance. I would choose this hotel again and again if I was in the area again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your headline "Awesome hotel....".

Summary Heading: Great Location for $$ if you just want a place for the evening
Summary: We planned on going to Wild Rivers (about 60 miles from home) so decided to make an overnight trip.  For the value, this place is great.  Heated pool, continental breakfast, free parking, and location, location, location.  We were 4 minutes from Wild Rivers in Irvine, about 15 minutes from San Clemente beach (where we spent the rest of the Labor Day weekend) & walking distance to every type of cuisine you could imagine all within a stone's throw from the Laguna Hills mall.  However, since it was on a major thoroughfare, there were plenty of emergency vehicles careening through odd hours of the day & night.  There's a quaint patio area on the 2nd floor of Bldg A which can be very inviting during the warm So Cal nights.  The heated pool was even more inviting.  The extra
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed one night. New rooms, nice bedding, quiet room facing garden area, great business center for free, very good continental breakfast. We were suppose to stay two nights and cancelled at the last minute. There were no penalties. Very pleasant experience. Would not hesitate to go back again. Also quite reasonable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at the Laguna Hills Lodge for years when we visit family in the area.  Service is good, grounds are attractive, an extended continental breakfast is included, and the motel is across the street from a shopping center and good seafood restaurant (King's).    Rooms were recently redecorated and the pool is well-maintained. A microwave and small refrigerator are in each room and free wi-fi is as well.    This is a solid value for someone who doesn't need to stay right on the beach at Laguna.  It is reasonably priced for the area and well-run.  The property is only a ten or fifteen minute drive from the Orange County Airport.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms ok, nothing bad and nothing good. Clean and relatively quiet. Breakfast is fine, but by day 3 Denny's a much better option. Most of the staff good (the two old ladies in reception are the exception) boy do you feel they are well past their best. Close to plenty of eating & drinking locs and good choice of venues. Lodge is trying hard in face of tough competition but rapidly lossing out to other local hotels (I have stopped staing at LHL and gone to Courtyrad)
Manager Response: To UKMS,  Thank you for your review.  I'd like to respond to your comment regarding "the two old ladies in reception {who are} well past their best."  Perhaps these "old ladies" that you speak of were before my time here at the Lodge, but I feel I should speak on behalf of our Front Desk staff who are dedicated, friendly, and knowledgable regardless of their age or background.  In regards to your comment about "rapidly losing out to other local hotels," I am proud to say that the Lodge currently offers rates below our competition as well as unrivaled promotions.  We find that guests and potential guests are extremely appreciative of the low rates and promotions during these tough times.  I hope this helps to clarify your concerns.  Thank you! The Laguna Hills Lodge

Summary: My wife and I stayed at Laguna Hills Lodge for one night.  We had some difficulty booking on the Internet (website wouldn't accept our reservation because something was wrong with the user name and password we were instructed to create), but when we finally contacted them by phone, the staff were friendly and helpful.  Check in was similarly efficient and pleasant.  We were in room 363 on the top floor facing the city offices.  The elevator made it easy to move our bags up to the room.  The room was large and outfitted with  microwave, big flat screen TV with many channels (including 3 HBO channels), free wi-fi, refrigerator (and a separate freezer), and coffee maker.  There's a small terrace, but you can't stand on it.  The hot air heater warms the room quickly.  When you go in
Manager Response: "Best of everything", thank so much for your comment!  We look forward to seeing you again soon ^_^.

Summary: We'd looked on the Internet at accomodation all around the Laguna area and decided not to stay at Laguna Beach mainly because of the very high prices. We're glad we chose the Laguna Hills Lodge because it had everything that we needed. It's just opposite a Shopping Mall and there are plenty of good eating places within walking distance although you will have to cross a main road. It's also a convenient base for getting to the coastal resorts and other tourist destinations in the area  We were allocated a ground floor room (there are lifts to the upper floors) and it was spacious, clean and very good value for money. Breakfast was served in the Mariposa room and was adequate with cereals, tea, coffee, toast, pastries and hard boiled eggs available as well as a selection of fresh
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I booked two rooms for three nights, and for rooms priced at a little over $100, I would say I received good value for my money.  The rooms are spacious and clean, the beds are firm, the grounds of the motel/hotel have beautiful flowers, the swimming pool and exercise room were well maintained, and the staff members were friendly.  The hotel is quite close to the freeway, making access to it very easy, but I didn't hear the traffic.  The breakfast isn't sumptuous, but it is more than adequate for someone who wants to start the day with something light and healthy.  I have also stayed at the nearby Ayres Hotel.  The Ayres offers somewhat more, but it also costs more than the LG Lodge.  I would stay at the Lodge again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: NO one told me they where under construction
Summary: I booked reservations and was not told they were under construction.  The noise was terrible and I was given an old room that needs work. The garden were in disarray since the painters were painting the builiding.  The staff was not accommodating. Terrible stay and left early.
Manager Response: As the Phoenix Traveler witnessed we have been undergoing a complete $2.7M renovation.  Our intentions have been to isolate each building during the renovation. We are 90% complete with a date of June 10th for the completion of the entire project. We have been getting excellent feedback from our guests.  They feel we have done a fantastic job.

Summary: The flowers/gardens are exceptionally beautiful and extremely well maintained. The room/furnishings were basic and clean. Very quiet. Had the pool to ourselves most of the time. Adequate exercise room w/treadmills and weight machine. Would stay again based on price, peaceful atmosphere and overall cleanliness despite it not feeling as cushy as a Red Lion or Marriott, for example (but then it doesn't have their pricetags).  My only gripe is why they have nice balconies overlooking a goregeous garden and there are not chairs on them (and the in-room chairs are too large to take out there). I really would have liked to sit on the balcony!  It was great, on the other hand, to have a fridge and microwave, which you don't get at alot of other places.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.

Summary: The accomodations were very nice. The grounds are absolutely beautiful---roses!!! everywhere! A really nice breakfast included in your room price. Reasonable rates.  The cons were very noisy patrons drinking on the patio until very late-and then waking up to their empty beer bottles left all over. I do not fault the Lodge for badly behaving guests. I could have complained then but I did not.
Manager Response: As a family owned business we thank you for your business!
